column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$3$I take Xanax a lot but was still having weird thoughts and panic at times. I have some dominate eye twitching since I started it but its not worth stopping it over an eye twitch. overall its the best medication I have been on since I was a teenager. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $2$1$3$"My 37 year old son
column3: living with us-his parents
column4: having Bipolar/late onset Auditory Schizophrenia was prescibed Latuda. It appeared to be working for the initial period - 3 weeks. Still having extreme auditory halluciations 24-7
column5: the dose was increased slighty. He began having panic attacks- It was right before the New Year
column6: so doctors were not available. I was able to help him through these daily attacks-- breathing etc. After 5 days

column1: he took his own life -shot himself with a hunting rifle. He had always said he would not or could not do this to us. Apparently
column2: this either gave him the courage to do so
column3: or it just was not working for him and he could not live with this anymore. It was no fault of anyone and I can understand why he did it so there was no anger. I just wanted to report that maybe this med needs to have doctor monitoring check-ins after 3 days of increasing a dose. I hope that we invest more money in research for the causes of mental illness instead of finding ""quick resolve"" by trying all meds the minute they are available. The switching of one drug and abrubtly changing to another MUST affect the brain chemistry. If drug companies care about the individual
column5: they would consider ALL side effects and HIGHLY emphasize the extreme risks of suicide. Sometimes
column6: the patient does not state nis/her feelings inside-- even to his ""soul mate""-me- his mother! Greiving such a loss is the ultimate saddness."

35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$5$"I am a 38 year old male who since childhood experienced schizoaffective symptoms but never received a consistent teatment. In the past I received paxil
column3: xanax and even colonopin; all of which had very negative side effects. I recently decided to try again as my symptoms have gotten too difficult to cope with. My Dr. prescribed Latuda and here are my results so far:

column1: *1st two weeks 20 mg tablets resulting in less depression
column2: more controllable sense of reality when alone (social settings still triggered psychosis) and longer sleep although with horrific nightmares. Side effects I felt were stiffness in my knees
column3: pain in my lower back

column2: lessened psychotic experiences when alone
column3: a better sense of control.Side effects were longer sleep but with horrific nightmares

column1: *2nd month Dr. increased dosage to 80 mg. Everything seemed the same as before with the exception of deeper sleep and weight gain (metabolism change). The next thing that happened was a disaster of which I am recovcering right now. I went to the beach and got sunburned
column2: was never told of any complications with sun exposure nor did I read anything on Latuda's site. I woke up the next morning with multiple wounds on my scalp discharging yellow fluid. My head and face have swollen up to such an extent I look disfigured. I went to the emergency room and more than $4000 of tests later everything was 'normal'. The physician could only attribute it to the medication's photo reactivity.  I went to my Dr. again today to show her my condition (which hasn't changed but gotten worse- for over 24 hours now) she also surmised it must be the photo reactivity
column3: reduced my dosage back to 40mg and recommended I stay out of the sun.

column1: Hope this info helps anyone considering using Latuda"

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$5$The one side effect I do exprience is a some what small amount of anxiety. Other than that

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have had difficulty with other antipsychotics and the metabolic disorder.  Latuda has enabled my cholesterol and blood sugar to drop back to nearly normal.  I am eating extremely healthy and have lost 10 pounds over a month.  I have been on Latuda 40 mg for 2 months.  My sleep schedule has been through many cycles
column3: from at first not sleeping at all and pacing
column5: and now I am finally sleeping 7 hours a day and higher functioning but at the wrong time (5 am to 12 pm).  Latuda has improved my memory and cognitive function to a level i never experienced in my life.  My delusions
column6: which were severe about the mafia  stalking me
column7: are gone and I am even in graduate school AND beginning my own art studio.  Saphris caused my triglycerides to be 1000 and Invega caused my blood sugar to be 500.  Abilify caused my body to jerk horribly as i tried to sleep.  Latuda has seen me through all metabolic syndrome healing and my body doesn't jerk.  So far I give Latuda a 15 out of 10!

309$Schizophrenia$11/14/2011 3:12:21 AM$Reviewer: Rhee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$Recently prescribed Latuda (40 mg) just yesterday so I have no idea how this is going to turn out for me. I am afraid to take this new med but I am also tired of constantly feeling like life is passing me by. I am losing life. I no longer know what happiness is. I don't want to jeopardize my life trying new meds but I need something to work. Hopefully this, Latuda, is the one that will give me my life back, with God's help of course.
